column2: OKLAHOMA DMV TEST
column6: OK

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. A traffic sign with a red circle around and a slash over a symbol means:
column4: the maneuver shown by the symbol is not allowed.
column6: Do not drive faster than the posted speed limit.
column8: the maneuver shown on the sign should be executed with extreme caution.
column10: the maneuver shown on the sign can be executed only after coming to a complete stop.

column2: 2. Warning signs normally are:
column6: octagons.
column8: diamond-shaped.

column2: 3. As you drive on the expressway, make sure:
column6: you cut off vehicles behind you when you change lanes.
column8: your directional signal goes off before you change lanes.

column2: 4. Roads are most slippery:
column6: when it first starts to rain.
column8: when it stops raining.

column2: 5. To see vehicles in your blind spots, you must look:
column6: over your shoulders.
column8: in your outside rearview mirror.

column2: 6. Night driving can be more difficult because:
column4: speed limits do not apply at night.
column6: visibility is reduced.
column8: vehicle operators tend to drive faster at night.
column10: the ratio of motorcyles to cars is much higher at night.

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column6: Left turns are permitted
column8: Wrong Way
column10: You may turn right after yielding the right-of-way to oncoming traffic

column2: 8. This road sign means:
column6: Yield ahead
column8: Detour

column2: 9. Drivers should be aware that a motorcyclist may:
column4: move to the center of the lane on steel deck bridges.
column6: quickly change speed or lane position.
column8: decrease speed and rise off the seat when approaching a railroad crossing.

column2: 10. You are stopped behind other vehicles waiting at a stop sign. When the intersection is clear:
column4: you may proceed with caution through the intersection without stopping if there is no other traffic.
column6: you must proceed through the intersection without stopping again.
column8: you may follow the vehicle ahead without stopping again.
column10: you must stop again at the stop sign.

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column6: Yield the right-of-way
column8: Prepare to stop

column2: 12. If you drink alcohol socially, what helps insure safe driving?
column4: Take a cold shower before driving.
column6: Stop drinking one hour before driving.
column8: Ride home with a friend who has not been drinking.

column2: 13. __________________ is a safe driving technique.
column4: Using your high beam lights in the fog
column6: Checking your rearview mirrors frequently
column8: Starring at the road ahead of your vehicle

column2: 14. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
column4: Adjust your schedule to drive during times with the most highway traffic.
column6: Listen to heavy metal music.
column8: Allow enough travel time to reach your destination on schedule.

column2: 15. Before entering a traffic circle, drivers must slow down and yield to ___________ in the traffic circle.
column6: vehicles
column8: pedestrians

column2: 16. After passing a vehicle, it is safe to return to your lane:
column6: when you can no longer see the vehicle over your right shoulder.
column8: when you are 50 feet ahead of the vehicle.
column10: when you see the front bumper of the other vehicle in your mirror.

column2: 17. When passing another car, you have enough room to return to the driving lane when:
column4: you cannot see the vehicle directly to your right.
column6: you have cleared the front bumper of the passed vehicle.
column8: you can see both headlights of the car you passed in your rearview mirror.
column10: you are at least 50 feet in front of the vehicle.

column2: 18. A driver cuts off another vehicle, or threatens another motorist or a pedestrian. These are examples of:
column6: furious driving
column8: defensive driving

column2: 19. It is unlawful­ to:
column4: exceed the posted speed limit when passing.
column6: pass within 250 feet of any intersection.
column8: pass within 150 feet of any railroad crossing.

column2: 20. If your car breaks down on the highway, you should:
column6: use your four-way flashers to warn other drivers.
column8: sound your horn to warn passing vehicles.
column10: flash your headlights at oncoming traffic.

column2: 21. Where must a pedestrian walk when there are no sidewalks?
column4: On the left side of the road, behind slower vehicles.
column6: In the middle of the road, facing oncoming traffic.
column8: On the side of the road, in the same direction of traffic.
column10: On the side of the road, facing the traffic.

column2: 22. If you see a “lane closed ahead” sign you should:
column4: merge into the correct lane when it is safe.
column6: make a U-turn. You are on the wrong side of the road.
column8: speed to the end of the closed lane and try to get into the other lane.

column2: 23. A pedestrian starts to cross in front of your vehicle. You should:
column4: sound your horn and proceed with caution.
column6: slow down.
column8: stop until the person is out of the crosswalk.
column10: speed up and pass in front of the pedestrian.

column2: 24. To pass a bicyclist traveling in the same direction on a two-lane road without bicycle lanes, you should:
column4: slow down and wait until there is no oncoming traffic, then pass the bicyclist leaving him or her  sufficient space.
column6: continue driving straight, it is the bicyclist’s responsibility to get out of your way.
column8: honk at the bicyclist to let him or her know you are about to pass.
column10: not pass the bicyclist until you come to a traffic signal or stop sign.

column2: 25. A driver who's being passed on the right and the left by many vehicles while driving in the center lane of an highway should:
column6: move to the lane on their right.
column8: move to the lane on their left.
